docs.snippet: U.S. documents published Friday indicate Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet covered up the military's role in the burning death of a 19-year-old U.S. resident during a 1986 protest, a case that drew worldwide condemnation and strained the regime's ...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. documents published Friday indicate Chilean dictator Augusto Pinochet covered up the military's role in the burning death of a 19-year-old U.S. resident during a 1986 protest, a case that drew worldwide condemnation and strained the regime's relationship with Washington.

headline.main: Report: Pinochet Covered Up Burning Death of US Resident
headline.print_headline: Report: Pinochet Covered Up Burning Death of US Resident

docs.snippet: After two elections in which liberals sought to cast them as the secretive face of the G.O.P., the billionaire brothers want to change perceptions of their family....
docs.lead_paragraph: After two elections in which liberals sought to cast them as the secretive face of the G.O.P., the billionaire brothers want to change perceptions of their family.
docs.abstract: Billionaires Charles G and David H Koch are working to change public perceptions of themselves, their family and Republican party following two presidential elections in which Democrats have portrayed them as representative of secretive elite; brothers have allied themselves with liberal causes such as criminal justice reform, while still raising large sums to defeat Democrats in 2016; critics charge populist gestures are cynical and self-serving.

headline.main: Koch Brothers Brave Spotlight to Try to Alter Their Image
headline.print_headline: Koch Brothers Brave Spotlight to Alter Image

docs.snippet: A federal magistrate on Friday entered a "temporary" not guilty plea for Dylann Roof on hate crime charges in the slaying of nine African-Americans at a South Carolina church, even as his lawyer said his client wanted to plead guilty....
docs.lead_paragraph: A federal magistrate on Friday entered a "temporary" not guilty plea for Dylann Roof on hate crime charges in the slaying of nine African-Americans at a South Carolina church, even as his lawyer said his client wanted to plead guilty.

headline.main: 'Temporary' Not Guilty Plea Entered for Charleston Suspect
headline.print_headline: 'Temporary' Not Guilty Plea Entered for Charleston Suspect

docs.snippet: The assailant, Yishai Schlissel, was said to have told the police that he had come “to kill in the name of God.”...
docs.lead_paragraph: The assailant, Yishai Schlissel, was said to have told the police that he had come “to kill in the name of God.”
docs.abstract: Yishai Schlissel, ultra-Orthodox Jewish man released from Israeli prison after serving 10 years for stabbing marchers in Jerusalem's gay pride parade in 2005, attacks parade again, stabbing six marchers and leaving two seriously wounded.

headline.main: Ultra-Orthodox Israeli Stabs 6 at a Gay Pride Parade for Second Time, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Ultra-Orthodox Israeli Stabs 6 at a Gay Pride Parade

docs.snippet: The white man accused of gunning down nine parishioners at a black church in Charleston wants to plead guilty to 33 federal charges, but his lawyer said in court Friday that he couldn't advise his client to do so until prosecutors say whether they...
docs.lead_paragraph: The white man accused of gunning down nine parishioners at a black church in Charleston wants to plead guilty to 33 federal charges, but his lawyer said in court Friday that he couldn't advise his client to do so until prosecutors say whether they'll seek the death penalty.

headline.main: Not Guilty Plea in Federal Court for Church Shooting Suspect
headline.print_headline: Not Guilty Plea in Federal Court for Church Shooting Suspect

docs.snippet: Dr. Nneka Jones Tapia, a clinical psychologist, was chosen to run Cook County Jail, underscoring how much the nation’s prisons have become holding centers for the mentally ill....
docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Nneka Jones Tapia, a clinical psychologist, was chosen to run Cook County Jail, underscoring how much the nation’s prisons have become holding centers for the mentally ill.
docs.abstract: Nneka Jones Tapia, psychologist at Cook County Jail in Illinois, has been appointed institution's executive director, becoming one of first clinical psychologists to run prison; appointment underscores extent to which prisons in United States have become holding pens for mentally ill and raises important issue as nation rethinks its prison system.

headline.main: A Psychologist as Warden? Jail and Mental Illness Intersect in Chicago
headline.print_headline: Troubled Inmates, and a Psychologist as Warden
